name: Lu Xun
description: Chinese modern writer and thinker, also known for his poetry, a significant figure in modern Chinese literature.

name: William Shakespeare
description: English playwright and poet, known for works like 'Hamlet', 'Romeo and Juliet', and 'Macbeth', pivotal in English literature.

name: Jane Austen
description: English novelist known for her insightful novels about British landed gentry, including 'Pride and Prejudice' and 'Emma'.

name: Mark Twain
description: American author known for his wit and satire, famous for 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' and 'Huckleberry Finn'.

name: Charles Dickens
description: British novelist, celebrated for vivid characters and depictions of Victorian life, works include 'Oliver Twist' and 'A Christmas Carol'.

name: Leo Tolstoy
description: Russian author known for 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina', exploring complex characters and universal themes.

name: J.K. Rowling
description: British author who created the 'Harry Potter' series, transforming modern fantasy literature and youth reading culture.

name: Ernest Hemingway
description: American novelist and short story writer, famous for his economical style and works like 'The Old Man and the Sea'.

name: George Orwell
description: British writer known for his political commentary, author of '1984' and 'Animal Farm', exploring totalitarianism and social injustice.

name: Agatha Christie
description: British writer, the 'Queen of Mystery', known for detective novels featuring Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.

name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Russian novelist, explored human psychology in troubled political, social, and spiritual contexts, works include 'Crime and Punishment'.

name: Edgar Allan Poe
description: American writer and poet, pioneer of the horror genre, known for tales of mystery and the macabre.

name: Gabriel García Márquez
description: Colombian novelist and Nobel laureate, known for 'One Hundred Years of Solitude', pioneer of magical realism.

name: Homer
description: Ancient Greek poet, traditionally said to be the author of epic poems 'The Iliad' and 'The Odyssey'.

name: Virginia Woolf
description: English writer, known for her modernist classics including 'Mrs Dalloway' and 'To the Lighthouse', exploring stream of consciousness.

name: Haruki Murakami
description: Japanese author known for blending magical realism with deep emotional narratives, works include 'Norwegian Wood'.

name: Oscar Wilde
description: Irish poet and playwright, celebrated for his epigrams, plays like 'The Importance of Being Earnest', and novel 'The Picture of Dorian Gray'.

name: Emily Dickinson
description: American poet, known for her unique, introspective, and often unconventional poetic style, with themes of death and immortality.

name: Franz Kafka
description: Bohemian novelist and short story writer, known for surreal and existential works like 'The Metamorphosis'.

name: John Steinbeck
description: American author, known for 'The Grapes of Wrath' and 'Of Mice and Men', depicting the Great Depression era.

name: Miguel de Cervantes
description: Spanish writer, best known for 'Don Quixote', considered the first modern novel, blending realism with chivalric romance.
